summary: An email from an investigative journalist/author to U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman, raising questions about the DOJ's handling of the Epstein case over multiple administrations and specifically implicating Ghislaine Maxwell and Prince Andrew. The author references their prior investigative work and seeks a quote for an upcoming book.

connections.description: Maxwell is described as a procurer for Epstein's child sex trafficking operation.
Maxwell is alleged to have personally introduced victims to Prince Andrew and organized sex trips for him.
According to the author's sources, Epstein paid for sexual services provided to Prince Andrew.
The author mistakenly spoke to Judge Richard Berman about the case, assuming he did not forward information to U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman.

keyFacts: The author, an investigative journalist, directly questions why three consecutive DOJ administrations (Bush, Obama, Trump) have protected Prince Andrew, referred to as 'Randy Andy'.
Ghislaine Maxwell is explicitly identified as the 'most damning procurer' who introduced victims to Prince Andrew and organized sex trips.

The document alleges, based on conversations and depositions, that Epstein paid for sexual services provided to Prince Andrew by a 17-year-old victim, though Epstein did not personally participate in those acts.
The author claims to have risked their life investigating the case beginning in 2010 and references their prior media series and book.
The correspondence is an attempt to get a quote from U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman for the author's upcoming book.
